discharge_summary: problem: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.
question: आंनि थार बेराम सिनायनाया मा? बेबायदि मोनो दि सुंद' बिबुंथिआ मोन्नै गुबुन गुबुन बाथ्रा बुंगासिनो दं।

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.
question: आं मानो एफा गोबाव हस्पितालाव दंमोन?
answer: नोंखौ 10 जुनआव हां लानो गोब्राब आरो गुजुनायजों इमार्जेन्सि बिफानाव थिसननाय जादोंमोन। 10 आगस्तआव, नोंनि हां लानाया बन्द' जादोंमोन, आरो नोंनो मोनसे अ'र'ट्रेकियाल इन्ट्युबेशन (हां लानायनि नलि) नि गोनांथि जादोंमोन।

question: बन्दरआ बुंदोंमोन दि आनजादा टि.बि. नि थाखाय पजिटिभमोन, नाथाय उनाव बुंदोंमोन दि नङामोन। आंनाव टि.बि. दंना?
answer: नोंनि गुजुनाय आनजादाव टि.बि. नि थाखाय मोनसे पजिटिभ फिथाइ दिन्थिदोंमोन। नाथाय, फाहामथायखौ जागायजेननाय जादोंमोन आरो उनाव बन्द' खालामनाय जादोंमोन मानोना नोंनि 'क्लिनिकेल लेबरेटरी सावगारिया फोसफोस एबा प्लुर'ल टिउबारकुलसिसजों मिलायाखैमोन,' आरो बेराम सिनायनायखौ 'जोबोद जाथावै नङा' होननानै साननाय जादोंमोन।

question: आं मानो थैनि गोबां-गैयै खालामग्रा वारफारिनखौ लानानै दं?
answer: देहा फाहामसालियाव थानाय समाव, नोंथाङा 'क्रनिक थ्रोम्बोसाइट' (प्लेटेलेटनि अनजिमा खम) बेरामजों नाख्रेबजादोंमोन। हेमेटलजि बिफानजों नोंथांखौ सावरायनाय जादोंमोन आरो जोबनायाव वारफारिन लोंनो जागायदोंमोन। बिथांखिया जादों 11/03 खालि जागायजेन्नाय वारफारिनजों थै जमा जानाय हाबाखौ 12/01 सिम 4 सप्तासिम सोलिहोबाय थानाय।

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. question: जेब्ला आंनि मेगनफोरा आगदाथिं नायगासिनो दंमोन अब्ला मा जादोंमोन?
answer: अक्ट'बर 15 खालि, नोंथाङा 'आगदा मेगननि स्ट्रैबिस्मस'जों सौफैदोंमोन। नोंथांखौ निउर'ल'जिजों बिजिरनाय जादोंमोन, आरो खर'नि सिटि स्केन आरो इलेक्ट्र'एन्सेफल'ग्रामनि उनाव, 'बेरामखौ थार होनना फोरमान खालामनो हानाय गोदान सोलायनायफोर गैयामोन,' आरो भिटामिन बि1 फिन सुफुंनो सुबुरुन होनाय जादोंमोन।

question: आंनि हासुदै आनजादाव मोनसे बेक्टेरिया मोनदों। आं मानो बेनि फाहामथाय मोनाखै?
answer: नोंनि हासुदै कालसारआव क्लेबसिएला निम'निया कार्बापेनेमेस पजिटिभ दिन्थिदों, नाथाय नोंनाव जेबो लैखोन गैयामोन आरो नोंनि किडनि फांक्सनआ मोजांमोन। बेनिखायनो, बेखौ फाहामनाय नङा होनना थिरांथा लानाय जादों, मानोना बेखौ लेथ्रा होनना साननाय जादोंमोन।

question: आं मानो बेक्ट्रिम (साल्फामेथ'क्साज'ल ट्राइमेथ'प्रिम) लानांगौ जाबाय?
answer: नोंथाङा (Aponi) सल्फामेथक्साजल ट्राइमेथ'प्रिम (ब्याक्ट्रिम) 'पी.सि.पि. होबथानाय आरो निउर'टक्सिसिटि'नि थाखाय जादों। बिथांखिया जादों 'ब्याक्ट्रिमजों लोगोसे पी.सि.पि. आरो निउर'टक्सखौ होबथानायखौ लाखिनाय'।

discharge_summary: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.

answer: बायपसि रिपर्टआ बुङो दि "सिमाइनि नेगेटिभिटिआ बार्किट लिम्फ'मानि बेराम सिनायनायखौ नागारो" आरो "आथिखालनि केसआ बार्किट लिम्फ'माजों गोरोबो।"

question: आं मानो लोमजादोंमोन आरो आं देहा फाहामसालियाव एन्टिबाय'टिक (सेफेपाइम आरो मेट्र'निडाजोल) लानो गोनां जादोंमोन?
answer: 16/08 खालि नोंनि लोमजानाया 38.1 डिग्रि सेलसियास सौहैदोंमोन, आरो थै साननाया 'निउट्र'पेनिया फारसे थांगासिनो दंमोन'। बेखौ 'लोमजानाय निउट्र'पेनिया, उदैनि इन्फेकसननि सायाव गोसो होनानै' होननानै सामलायनाय जादोंमोन, बेखायनो 'सेफामिपाइम आरो मेट्र'निडाजोल' जागायनो थिरांथा लानाय जादोंमोन।

discharge_summary: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. question: आंनि सि.टि. स्केनआव मा नुजादों? मा बेयाव माबा इन्फेक्सन दंमोन?
answer: 'जेरबा सि.टि. स्केनआव जेबो सोलायनाय नुनो मोनाखैमोन,' आरो 'साइनास सि.टि. स्केनआव फ्रन्टेल साइनास आरो मेस्टइडआव थाथायनि फोरमान मोनदोंमोन।' मोनसे एन्डोस्कोपिक बिजिरनायाव 'गाग्लोबग्रा फंगसनि इन्फेक्सननि जेबो फोरमान मोनाखैमोन।'

discharge_summary: 1. bloodstream infection associated with Schilley catheter in the right femoral vein sac 11/08 2. bacterial endocarditis associated with catheter echocardiogram 11/18: presence of vegetation in the mitral valve 3. pyogenic spondylodiscitis in l3/l4 11/05: low back pain, gait disturbance, computed tomography of the lumbosacral spine 11/12: findings suggestive of a fracture due to bone fragility of the vertebral body of l1, gas foci in the spinal canal at the level of l2l3 that may be related to an extruded disc herniation with degenerative disc disease, and an infectious or inflammatory process cannot be ruled out, lumbar magnetic resonance imaging 25/11/2020: infectious spondylodiscitis with anterior epidural abscess 4. left ileopsoas abscess, magnetic resonance imaging 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the ileopsoas left 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and adjacent post-contrast enhancement. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 01/02/2021, stay: 01 m 24 d 15 h, location: ward: ward payer: sus. [person] attends hemodialysis session with severe left lower back pain that had started 3 days ago, associated with asthenia, and altered gait. [person] who was accompanying him, denies fever, nausea, and vomiting. Denies other associated symptoms. catheter dressing in the right femoral vein was secreting. [person] evolved during hospitalization with a diagnosis of bloodstream infection by staphylococcus aureus mrsa, complicated by l2l4 spondylodiscitis, mitral valve infective endocarditis, and ileopsoas muscle abscess. Catheter removed on 11/08 and antibiotic therapy guided by vancomycin culture was started on 11/08. Abscess in psoas was not approached due to interposition of bowel loops in an attempt at percutaneous drainage by the {organization} on 12/02. Comparative radiological improvement was observed in axial lesions and conservative treatment was maintained regarding foci of infection identified during hospitalization. [person] remained afebrile with successively negative blood cultures. As a complication associated with immobility, he developed sacral pressure injury, treated with surgical debridement and local measures. Injury care guidelines were provided by the team. He evolved with the need for hemodialysis on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays due to arteriovenous fistula in the left upper limb, but local stenosis was noted. He is currently on renal replacement therapy. good general condition, pale 1/4, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile to the touch and eupneic in room air. neurology: conscious and oriented in time, space and person. respiratory auscultation: bilateral vesicular breath sounds with discreet bibasilar crackles, no signs of respiratory distress. cardiac auscultation: irregular heart rhythm, with normal sound sounds, no murmurs. abdomen: protuberant, bowel sounds, normotensive, painless on superficial or deep palpation, no signs of peritoneal irritation. warm and well perfused extremities. upper limbs: fistula in the left upper limb with present thrill. lower limbs: presence of discreet edema and anterior tibial ochre dermatitis. nuclear magnetic resonance 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the left ileopsoas 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and post-contrast enhancement adjacent cultures: catheter tip 11/08: vancomycin-sensitive staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/08: staphylococcus aureus sg catheter 11/08 staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/11: staphylococcus aureus oxa r in 2 samples blood culture 11/21: citrobacter koseri 1 sample staphylococcus aureus 1 sample blood culture 11/24: staphylococcus capitis blood culture 11/28: negative blood culture 12/01: negative blood culture 12/02: negative. attempted percutaneous abscess question: आंनाव मा रोखोमनि सनदेरनाय जादोंमोन?
answer: नोंहा स्टेफिलोकोकास अरियास एमआरएसए निफ्राय थैनि सन्देरनाय जादोंमोन, जाय नोंनि सिनस्रिआव स्पन्डिल'आर्थराइटिस, नोंनि मैखुन भाल्भफोराव सन्देरग्रा एन्ड'कार्डिटिस, आरो नोंनि इलिय'स्प'आस मोदोम गेहेनाव मोनसे गारायजों गोब्राब जादोंमोन।

question: आंनि बिखुङा मानो एसेबां सादोंमोन?
answer: नोंनि आगसि गाहाय बिखुंआव जोबोद सागासिनो दंमोन। एम.आर.आइ.आ दिन्थिदोंमोनदि नोंहा स्पाइनेल कर्डआव एन्टेरिय'र एपिड्युरेल एब्सेसजों लोगोसे मोनसे इन्फेक्सियास स्पन्डिलाइटिस दंमोन।

question: बिसोर मानो आंनि मोदोम गेहेननिफ्राय गोमोदैखौ बोखारनो हायाखै?
answer: 12/02/2020 आव बे सिथरखौ मोनसे गाराय खालामनो नाजानाया जाफुंसार जायाखैमोन मानोना बिबुनि लुपफोरनि गेजेराव मैला दंमोन, ओंथिया नोंनि बिबुफोरा दासिमबो हेंथा होजादोंमोन।

question: न'आव थांनाय समाव आं मा मुलि जानांगौ?
answer: नोंथांनो 01/09/2021 सिम मोनफ्रोमबो थि खालामनाय हिम'डायलाइसिसनि उनाव 0.5 ग्राम भेनकोमाइसिन होनो नांगोन। नोंथांनि सिगांनि गोबाव समनि मुलिफोरखौबो सोलिहोबाय थानाय जादोंमोन।

question: सनदेरनाया थांबाय नामा?
answer: बिथाङा लोमजानाय गैयैमोन आरो 28 नबेम्बरनिफ्राय लासै-लासै गाज्रि थैनि कालसार मोनदोंमोन। बेनि अनगायैबो, गारायफोराव रुजुजाथाव रेडिय'ल'जिकेल जौगानाय दंमोन।

question: आंनि डायालिसिस फिस्टुलायाव मा जेंना दं?
answer: नोंनि आख्सि आखाइनि सा बाहागोआव थानाय थै रोदा आरो थै सिरिनि सिङाव मोनसे जायगायारि स्टेन'सिस नुनो मोनदों। स्टेन'सिसनि जायगाखौ थि खालामनो थाखाय मोनसे बिजिरनायनि गोनांथि दं।

discharge_summary: 1. bloodstream infection associated with Schilley catheter in the right femoral vein sac 11/08 2. bacterial endocarditis associated with catheter echocardiogram 11/18: presence of vegetation in the mitral valve 3. pyogenic spondylodiscitis in l3/l4 11/05: low back pain, gait disturbance, computed tomography of the lumbosacral spine 11/12: findings suggestive of a fracture due to bone fragility of the vertebral body of l1, gas foci in the spinal canal at the level of l2l3 that may be related to an extruded disc herniation with degenerative disc disease, and an infectious or inflammatory process cannot be ruled out, lumbar magnetic resonance imaging 25/11/2020: infectious spondylodiscitis with anterior epidural abscess 4. left ileopsoas abscess, magnetic resonance imaging 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the ileopsoas left 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and adjacent post-contrast enhancement. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 01/02/2021, stay: 01 m 24 d 15 h, location: ward: ward payer: sus. [person] attends hemodialysis session with severe left lower back pain that had started 3 days ago, associated with asthenia, and altered gait. [person] who was accompanying him, denies fever, nausea, and vomiting. Denies other associated symptoms. catheter dressing in the right femoral vein was secreting. [person] evolved during hospitalization with a diagnosis of bloodstream infection by staphylococcus aureus mrsa, complicated by l2l4 spondylodiscitis, mitral valve infective endocarditis, and ileopsoas muscle abscess. Catheter removed on 11/08 and antibiotic therapy guided by vancomycin culture was started on 11/08. Abscess in psoas was not approached due to interposition of bowel loops in an attempt at percutaneous drainage by the {organization} on 12/02. Comparative radiological improvement was observed in axial lesions and conservative treatment was maintained regarding foci of infection identified during hospitalization. [person] remained afebrile with successively negative blood cultures. As a complication associated with immobility, he developed sacral pressure injury, treated with surgical debridement and local measures. Injury care guidelines were provided by the team. He evolved with the need for hemodialysis on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays due to arteriovenous fistula in the left upper limb, but local stenosis was noted. He is currently on renal replacement therapy. good general condition, pale 1/4, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile to the touch and eupneic in room air. neurology: conscious and oriented in time, space and person. respiratory auscultation: bilateral vesicular breath sounds with discreet bibasilar crackles, no signs of respiratory distress. cardiac auscultation: irregular heart rhythm, with normal sound sounds, no murmurs. abdomen: protuberant, bowel sounds, normotensive, painless on superficial or deep palpation, no signs of peritoneal irritation. warm and well perfused extremities. upper limbs: fistula in the left upper limb with present thrill. lower limbs: presence of discreet edema and anterior tibial ochre dermatitis. nuclear magnetic resonance 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the left ileopsoas 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and post-contrast enhancement adjacent cultures: catheter tip 11/08: vancomycin-sensitive staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/08: staphylococcus aureus sg catheter 11/08 staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/11: staphylococcus aureus oxa r in 2 samples blood culture 11/21: citrobacter koseri 1 sample staphylococcus aureus 1 sample blood culture 11/24: staphylococcus capitis blood culture 11/28: negative blood culture 12/01: negative blood culture 12/02: negative. attempted percutaneous abscess puncture on 12/02 not performed due to interposition of intestinal loops. nuclear magnetic resonance report of the pelvis performed on 12/16. agreed with [organization] for chronic patients to attend the hemodialysis room at [organization] on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, with transportation from the city of origin to the unit carried out by stretcher taxi {omitted}. therefore, we discharge the patient with the following pending issues: observations: administer 0.5 g of vancomycin after each scheduled hemodialysis session antibiotic therapy until 01/09/2021, completing 6 weeks after the last negative blood culture assessment of arteriovenous fistula: phlebography of arteriovenous fistula indicated assess fistulography by brachial to determine the site of stenosis and then perform phlebography or assess pre-procedure with ultrasound in the room. [person] placed on list. [organization] will contact you to schedule a treatment, as recorded in the note by the sacral pressure injury specialist team: [person]'s outpatient follow-up appointment on 16/01/2021 for pressure injury reassessment. Instructions for home care of the injury were provided. Cardiology follow-up for amyloidosis investigation: [person] missed a follow-up appointment appointment on 09/09, scheduled for 01/13 for motor rehabilitation. We are awaiting an appointment by the physiatry department at [organization] requested on 12/27. Check the nuclear magnetic resonance report of the pelvis from 12/16. Previous chronic medications were maintained. Dialysis room Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. Amyloidosis cardiology outpatient clinic 01/13. Pressure injury surgery outpatient clinic 01/16.
question: आंनाव मा फ'ल'-आप एपइन्टमेन्टफोर दं?
answer: नोंथांहा 13/01 खालि कार्डिय'लजिस्टजों मोनसे मिटिं दं आरो 16/01/2021 खालि नोंथांनि प्रेसारनि जोखोमनि थाखाय मोनसे फ'ल'-आप दं। नोंथाङा मटर रिहेबिलिटेसननि थाखायबो मोनसे एपइन्टमेन्टनि थाखाय नेगासिनो दं।

question: आंनि केथेटेरआ मा जाखो?
answer: नोंनि आगदा फेन्दा थै रोदायाव शिले केथेटारजों सोमोन्दो गोनां थैनि इन्फेक्सन जादोंमोन, आरो बेयो ड्रेसिंनिफ्राय गगारगासिनो दंमोन। केथेटारखौ 11/08 आव बोखारनाय जादोंमोन।

question: आंनि बिखानि स्केनआ मा दिन्थिदों?
answer: 18 नबेम्बराव मोनसे इक'कार्डियग्रामआ मिट्रल भाल्भआव बिफां-लाइफांनि थाथायखौ दिन्थिदोंमोन, जाय बेक्टेरिया एन्ड'कार्डिटिसजों सोमोन्दो गोनांमोन।

discharge_summary: 1 decompensated ic bc profile? decompensated pulmonary hypertension? liver injury? chronic liver disease? awaiting transthoracic echocardiography requested on 08/11 hypervolemia with transudate-type pleural effusion ascites edema lower limbs, on electrocardiogram: axis deviated to the right, signs of right atrial overload, inactive area on lateral wall. on tomography protocol pulmonary thromboembolism: dilated right atrium and ventricle, reflux of contrast into vena cava. blood gases: chronic co2 retention pattern normal bnp for age. hypoalbuminemia thrombocytopenia tgo tgp moderate volume ascites 2 perineal and lower limb cellulitis ruled out fournier by surgical team 08/11 3 pneumonia associated with mechanical ventilation worsening of secretion ventilatory worsening fever escalated antibiotic therapy for meropenem vancomycin on 08/16 and maintained metronidazole ruled out coronavirus. Negative pcr on 08/17, x-ray with right pleural effusion. Underwent diagnostic and relief thoracentesis on 08/18. 800 ml of serohematic-colored fluid was removed; transudate 4; acute kidney injury; baseline creatinine i code; admission: 0.98; clcr: 88 ml/min; kinetic 08/18: 48 ml/min; etiology: nta secondary to sepsis? hyperna hyperk; increased creatine phosphokinase; 5; atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response secondary to septic shock and fever 40º / lidocaine? amiodarone attack started 300 mg 300 mg and maintenance 900 mg/day on 08/18; cumulative dose of amiodarone on 08/19: 1.5g. admission: 08/11/2020, discharge: 08/20/2020, stay: 09 d 02 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] with a history of productive cough with whitish secretion, edema in the lower limbs, and dyspnea on moderate exertion for approximately 34 months, evolving with progressive worsening of dyspnea on mild exertion and a decline in general condition for approximately 2 weeks associated with odynophagia. 1 week ago [person] began to experience edema, hyperemia, heat, and pain in the genital region extending to the lower abdomen. He was taken to the emergency care unit and started on ceftriaxone 2 g/day d1 08/06 and later referred to [organization], where he was intubated due to acute respiratory failure. He was transferred to {organization} via advanced life support ambulance, intubated, hemodynamically stable, using dobutamine 20 ml/h and sedative and analgesia with fentanyl, midazolam and atracurium. No history of fever, rhinorrhea, sneezing, fever or other complaints. Serious general condition, flushed, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, feverish RAS4 pupils isomiotic respiratory auscultation vesicular breath sounds, reduced globally, with crackles in bases cardiac auscultation: 2 arrhythmic and normophonetic sounds in 2t without murmurs globular abdomen, normal bowel sounds, normotensive presence of sacral pressure injury. Heat in lower limbs legs bilaterally associated with edema. no signs of deep vein thrombosis genitalia with edema in penis and scrotum, associated with hyperemia and ulcer of approximately 1.5 cm in the foreskin of the bottom pustular lesion on the back, scaly cold and poorly perfused extremities. no surgeries performed. no pending exams. [person] evolved to death. discharged death.
question: आंनो इनटुबेट खालामनाय जादोंमोन मानो?
answer: बिथांखौ "इन्टुबेटेड हां लानाय मेसिनआव दोननाय जादोंमोन मानोना बिथाङा जोबोद गाज्रि जाथाय मोनगासिनो दंमोन।"

question: आंनि आथोन आरो आथिंआव मा बेराम जादोंमोन?
answer: नोंहा ‘पेरिनेल आरो गाहाय अंगनि सेलुलाइटिस’ दंमोन। नों ‘लिंङाइ आरो आथोननि गान्थिनि एडिमा, हाइपारेमिया आरो आलसारजों सोमोन्दो गोनांमोन’।

question: आंनि संफ्ल'आव मा जेंना दंमोन?
answer: बिहा 'मेकानिकेल भेन्टिलेसनजों सोमोन्दो थानाय निउमनिया' दंमोन आरो एक्स-रेआव 'आगदा फारसेनि प्लुरेल इफुजन' (जेरबायाव लावलाव) नुनो मोनदोंमोन। बिहा हां लानायाव गोब्राब मोनदोंमोन, आरो मोनफ्रोम हां लानायनि जोबनायाव 'स्वरस्वर सोदोब' (हां लानाय समाव सोदोब) मोनदोंमोन।

question: आंनि मैखुननि खारथाइजों मा जेंना जादोंमोन?
answer: नोंहा 'गोजौ भेन्ट्रिकुलार फिनजाथायजों एट्रियेल फाइब्रिलेसन' दंमोन जायखौ 'सेप्टिक शक आरो 40º लोमजानायनि नैथि बेराम' महरै मुंख'नाय जादोंमोन। नोंनि 'कार्डियाक आसकल्टेसन' (मैखुननि सोदोब खोनासंनो हानाय) आ मोनसे 'एरिथमिक... सोदोब' दिन्थिदोंमोन।

discharge_summary: coronavirus . admission: 2020-03-15, discharge: 2020-05-11, stay: 01 m 25 d 17 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 59 years old, from [address] patient admitted on 2020-03-15 to the emergency unit of [organization] due to severe acute respiratory syndrome caused by coronavirus. patient in need of orotracheal intubation since 2020-03-17 with progression to tracheostomy on 2020-04-08. evolved with improvement in respiratory parameters being decannulated on 2020-05-08, remaining without tracheostomy, without respiratory discomfort, only with occlusive dressing. presented several complications during hospitalization, such as: 1 low-embolic load pulmonary thromboembolism, examination described below; 2 pulmonary septic shock with carbapenem-sensitive Acinetobacter baumannii, being treated with meropnem and polymyxin for 10 days and subsequently using tigecycline for 14 days, with improvement in the condition; 3 acute kidney injury, code 3, without the need for dialysis with subsequent reversal; 4 primary bloodstream infection secondary to Burkholderia cepacia, sensitive to ceftazidime and Bactrim. evolved with rehabilitation with motor and respiratory physiotherapy, with good tolerance and improved functionality during hospitalization. [person] without the need for oxygen therapy for more than 48 hours, with the need to consolidate treatment for bloodstream infection with oral Bactrim. opted for hospital discharge after a long period of hospitalization with improvement in the coronavirus condition and hospital complications. described below is the schedule for ending treatment for [person] after discharge. good general condition, pale 2/4, hydrated, oriented in time and space, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, eupneic heart rate: 70 oxygen saturation: 98% in room air cardiac auscultation: heart rhythm in normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, normal heart sounds, preserved capillary refill time, absence of jugular distension at 90º respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds present, no adventitious sounds, absence of use of accessory respiratory muscles abdomen: flaccid, painless, bowel sounds present and normal, tympanic to percussion, no palpable masses or palpable visceromegaly extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, well perfused extremities, absence of edema in the lower limbs, absence of signs of deep vein thrombosis neurology: Glasgow Coma Scale 15, presence of tremor postural in upper limbs. coronavirus pulmonary thromboembolism. schedule: anticoagulation for 6 months counting the start of treatment from 03/31/2020 ending on 09/31/2020 at the moment there is a need to use rivaroxaban 15 mg 12/12 h for another 7 days after discharge and subsequently use of a dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg/day until 05/07/2020. end of treatment for bloodstream infection with bactrin 2 tablets 8/8 hours for another 5 days after hospital discharge requested maintenance of respiratory and motor physiotherapy in [person's] city of origin. hospitalization exams: chest CT Angiography (CTA) 03/31: acute pulmonary thromboembolism with low embolic burden, without cor pulmonale. opacities compatible with coronavirus, severe involvement 50 - 75% with a component of organizing pneumonia and fibroreaction. cardiomegaly. Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: आं मानो एफा गोबाव हस्पिटेलाव दंमोन?

discharge_summary: admission: 05/28/2020, discharge: 06/06/2020, stay: 09 d 04 h, location: ward, payer: sus. identification: [person], 80 years old, from [address], social worker, retired, married. problem: 1 sepsis of pulmonary focus treated with ceftriaxone d10 clarithromycin d8 pulmonary focus: productive cough flu-like symptoms fever dyspnea desaturation 6 days ago acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creat 2.14 / basal 0.68 discharged from nephrology on 06/05. hypotension requiring norepinephrine. 2 atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response 05/28 reversed amiodarone chads2vas 4. 3 urinary tract infection candida treated with fluconazole. History of current illness: Patient with previous chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, under treatment with anoro umeclidino vilanterol, with a history of smoking, discontinued in 1988 53 pack-years. Reports that 6 days ago he started having a productive cough, associated with runny nose, nasal obstruction and shortness of breath, as well as a fever of 38 ºC in the first 3 days of symptoms. 3 days ago, he had an appointment with a pulmonologist, and was started on oseltamivir every 12 hours, but for the past 1 day he has been developing worsening shortness of breath, ventilatory-dependent pain in the back and lung bases, as well as a decline in general condition. Reports having taken tests for coronavirus and influenza, both negative. Denies gastrointestinal and genitourinary complaints. No other complaints. Personal history: 1. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (IPD)? Aspiration?? Spirometry 2019: obstruction with FEV1 31.59%, FVC 63.9%, no response to bronchodilator. Chest computed tomography 2021: emphysema, reticular infiltrate without honeycombing in the right base. Aspiration? 2. Systemic arterial hypertension 3. Diabetes mellitus 4. Hypothyroidism 5. Depressive disorder under current treatment. 6. Hearing impairment under treatment with a hearing aid. Continuous-use medications: Anoro, Metformin 1000 mg/day, Dapagliflozin 10 mg, Escitalopram 10 mg, Puran T 125 mcg, Rosuvastatin 5 mg, Calcium carbonate 1000 mg/day, Vit D3 1000 IU/day. Allergies: Denies. Surgeries: Denies. habits and addictions: denies alcoholism, smoking 52 pack-years; quit in 1988. antibiotic therapy ceftriaxone 1g 12/12h 05/28 06/06 clarithromycin 500 mg 12/12h 05/28 05/06 fluconazole 05/31 06/06. tests: transthoracic echocardiography 05/30/2020: mild left atrial dilation. concentric left ventricular remodeling, preserved systolic performance of the ventricles. normal left ventricular segmental mobility. mild mac mitral annular calcification. mild mitral and ai. clinical evolution [organization] finds [person] in a ward bed accompanied by [person]. hemodynamically stable, using a central venous catheter, no vasoactive drugs, and an indwelling urinary catheter. [person] reports improvement in respiratory condition, with reduction in fatigue and inspiratory pain and improvement in cough in appearance and volume, but reports that dyspnea persists with minimal effort such as taking a bath. question: आं देहा फाहामसालियाव मानो दंमोन?
answer: नोंहा ‘पालमनेरि फकास सेपसिस’ (समफ्ल सनदेरनाय) दंमोन। नोंहा ‘दिहुनथायारि गुजुनाय, फ्लु बायदि लैखोनफोर, लोमजानाय, हां लानायाव खम आरो 6 सान सिगांनिफ्राय हां लानायाव जेंना’ दंमोन।

question: आंनि किदनिफोरा मा जाखो?
answer: नोंहा मोनसे 'गोख्रों किदनि जखम kdigo 3' जादोंमोन। नोंखौ '06/05' आव नेफ्र'ल'जिनिफ्राय हगारनाय जादोंमोन आरो हगारनायनि समाव, नोंहा 'किदनिनि खामानि मोनफिननाय' जादोंमोन।

question: आंनि मैखुनखौ मा जादों?
answer: नोंथाङा 28 मेआव 'गोजौ भेन्ट्रिकुलार रेस्पन्सजों एट्रियेल फाइब्रिलेसन' मोनदोंमोन, जाय 'सरासनस्रा नङामोन'। नोंथांनि इक'कार्डिय'ग्राफिआव 'एसे आगसि एट्रियेल डाइलेसन' दिन्थिदोंमोन।

question: आंनो एमिअ'डेर'न आरो रिभार'क्साबानखौ मानो होनाय जादों?
answer: नोंथाङा एमिय'ड्र'नखौ 'खबाम सामलायनाय'नि थाखाय आरो रिभारक्सबानखौ 'एन्टिक'गलेसन'नि थाखाय नाजावगासिनो मानोना नोंथांहा एट्रियेल फिब्रिलेसन (CADS2 नि 4) आरो 'एट्रियेल बारायनाय'नि थाखाय 'जाफिननायनि गोबां गिनांगौ' दं।

question: आं आबुङै मोजां ना? आंनि हां लानाया माबोरै दं?
answer: नोंनि 'क्लिनिकेल जौगानाय' आरो 'हां लानायनि थासारि'आ जौगागासिनो दं। नाथाय, नों 'बुंदों दि दुगैनाय बायदि एसेल' नाजानायनि उनावबो हां लानो गोब्राब (हां लानायाव जेंना) सोलिबाय थायो।'

question: बे 'प्रक्टिल मलम' आ मानि थाखाय?
answer: देहा फाहामसालियाव थानाय समाव, नोंनि पाइलिया गाज्रिसिन जालांदोंमोन, आरो दा बेयो ओंखारलांगासिनो दं। बेनि थाखाय 'प्रक्टाइल मलम' आ 'जायगानि रैखाथि गोनां फाहामथाय' नि मोनसे बाहागो।

question: आंनि उनसंनाय बिथांखिया मा?
answer: नोंथाङा 28/06 नि बेलासियाव जेरियाट्रिक स्पेसियालिस्टजों ‘टेलिफनिक कनसाल्टेशन’ खालामगोन। नोंथांनो ‘कनत्रल इलेकट्र’कारदियग्राम, फ’ल-आपनि थाखाय लेबरेटरि आनजाद, 27/06 आव थि खालामनाय’ निबो गोनां जागोन।

discharge_summary: 1 human immunodeficiency virus c3 human immunodeficiency virus recent diagnosis october 2020 weight loss and asthenia for two months cd4 18, viral load: 1,153,464 2 progressive dyspnea presumed pneumocystosis diffuse bilateral interstitial pulmonary infiltrate evolved with respiratory failure and need for supplemental oxygen noninvasive ventilation started on 10/15 bactrim 10/15 11/05 pulmonary cytomegalovirus? ganciclovir started on 10/22 treatment of community-acquired pneumonia with clarithomycin 10/15 10/20 and ceftriaxone 10/14 10/25 due to lack of clinical improvement and increasing needs for 02: tazocim started on 10/25 escalated to meropenem, polymyxin b and vancomycin hemodynamic worsening and tracheal aspirate with klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase intubated on 10/29 pulmonary tuberculosis tbtrm of bronchial lavage 11/03: positive tbtrm traces and previous negative sputum smears started ripe on 11/05 3 candidemia blood culture 10/28: candida orthopsilosis hemodynamic worsening 4 acute heart failure? secondary to myocarditis? secondary to taktosubo? 5 arrhythmia on 11/04 amiodarone impregnation on 11/04 900 mg/24h modified to 300 mg 8x8 h on 11/05 modified to 200 mg 8x8 h enteral on 11/06 6 frontal headache, without focal signs or new deficit, also two months ago 7 treated oral candidiasis 8 hyponatremia of etiology to be clarified siadh? 9 refractory septic shock pulmonary focus? catheter?. admission: 10/15/2020, discharge: 11/23/2020, stay: 01 m 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] with a recent diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus, was admitted to [organization] on 10/15 complaining of dyspnea, fatigue, fever, and cough. He began treatment for pneumocystosis and with clarithromycin and ceftriaxone for pneumonia. On 10/16, he was referred to [organization], where he continued to worsen his respiratory condition, having started treatment with ganciclovir for cytomegalovirus and with a new need for antimicrobial escalation. Even so, [person] evolved with worsening, being referred to the intensive care unit on 10/28. On 10/29, [person] developed hypotension and respiratory failure, having undergone orotracheal intubation since then. On 11/04, he presented tachyarrhythmia, and impregnation with amiodarone was started, and RIP was started due to the presence of TBTRM in the bronchial lavage with positive traces of tuberculosis. [person] continued to use vasoactive drugs, having shown no improvement even after new antimicrobial escalations and continued to present progressive clinical worsening, beginning to require hemodialysis. on 11/20 [person] began to present significant worsening of hemodynamic shock, having evolved with the need for vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, not even having tolerated the first hemodialysis session that would be performed on 11/21. despite the use of vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, [person] evolved with progressive hypotension, until on 11/23 he evolved to death. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. no surgeries or procedures were performed. no pending tests. no therapeutic plan or education to be carried out. [person] evolved to death. confirmed death at {omitted}.

[person] with a recent diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus, was admitted to [organization] on 10/15 complaining of dyspnea, fatigue, fever, and cough. He began treatment for pneumocystosis and with clarithromycin and ceftriaxone for pneumonia. On 10/16, he was referred to [organization], where he continued to worsen his respiratory condition, having started treatment with ganciclovir for cytomegalovirus and with a new need for antimicrobial escalation. Even so, [person] evolved with worsening, being referred to the intensive care unit on 10/28. On 10/29, [person] developed hypotension and respiratory failure, having undergone orotracheal intubation since then. On 11/04, he presented tachyarrhythmia, and impregnation with amiodarone was started, and RIP was started due to the presence of TBTRM in the bronchial lavage with positive traces of tuberculosis. [person] continued to use vasoactive drugs, having shown no improvement even after new antimicrobial escalations and continued to present progressive clinical worsening, beginning to require hemodialysis. on 11/20 [person] began to present significant worsening of hemodynamic shock, having evolved with the need for vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, not even having tolerated the first hemodialysis session that would be performed on 11/21. despite the use of vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, [person] evolved with progressive hypotension, until on 11/23 he evolved to death. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. no surgeries or procedures were performed. no pending tests. no therapeutic plan or education to be carried out. [person] evolved to death. confirmed death at {omitted}.

question: आंनो एमिअ'ड'र'नखौ मानो होनाय जादोंमोन?

question: फाहामथायनि जाउनाव आं हामखांबाय नामा?
answer: नों जेबो जौगानाय दिन्थियाखै आरो गोदान एन्टिबाय'टिकफोरनि उनावबो नोंनि थासारिया गाज्रिसिन जाबोबाय थानायखाय क्लिनिकआव लांनांगौ जादों।

question: जोबनायाव मा जादोंमोन?
answer: गोब्राब ट्रेंकुइलाइजारफोर बाहायनायनि उनावबो, बे सुबुङा लासै-लासै गोब्राब हाइप'टेन्सन जादोंमोन, आरो जोबनायाव 11/23 आव थैदोंमोन।

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: देहा फाहामसालियाव आं मा गुबै जेंनाफोरजों मोगा-मोगि जानांदोंमोन?
answer: सुंद’यै, नोंनि जेंनाफोरा फारिलाइ खालामनाय जादों: 1. संफ्ल’नि इन्फेकसननि थाखाय स्टेटस एपिलेप्टिकस (सिजारफोर), 2. संफ्ल’निफ्राय सेप्सिस (इन्फेकसन), 3. नोंनि आगदा आथिंआव गोथौ थै रोदा थ्रम्बसिस (थै थुबुर जानाय), 4. सिउद’मेम्ब्रेनस कलाइटिस, आरो 5. सेप्सिसनि थाखाय एड्रेनेल आंखाल।

question: थांनायनि उनाव आं मानो एन्टिबाय'टिक सेफ्टाजिडाइम लानांगौ?
answer: नोंथाङा 'चूड'मनास थै बोहैनायनि इन्फेक्सन' नि थाखाय सेफ्टाजिडाइम जागासिनो दं। बिथांखिया '7-10 सान' सिम सोलिबाय थानो।

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. question: आं मानो गोबां रोखोमनि सिजारनि मुलिफोर जागासिनो दं?
answer: बिथांखिया जादों 'फैगौ एपइन्टमेन्टसिम आथिखालनि एन्टिसाइक'टिक मुलिफोरखौ लाखिनाय'। फारिलाइयाव फेनिटिन, फेन'बार्बिटल, ट'पिरामेट, क्ल'बेजाम आरो लेम'ट्रिजिने दं।

question: आंनो 6 दाननि थाखाय रिभार'क्साबानखौ मानो होनाय जादों?
answer: बे प्रिस्क्रिप्शनआ 'गोथौ थै रोदा थ्रम्ब'सिस' (थै जमा जानाय) नि थाखाय जायखौ नोंथाङा 'आगदा गाहाय फारसे' आव सिनायथि मोनदों। प्रिस्क्रिप्शनआ 'रिभ'रक्साबान 20 मिलिग्राम/सान... 6 दाननि थाखाय'।

question: आं मानो सासे फिजियथेरापिस्टखौ नायनांगौ?
answer: नोंथाङा 'सी.इ.ए.आर.' फिजियथेरापिनि थाखाय उनसंनाय जोथोन नांगोन मानोना नोंथांहा 'गरायनि आथिंजों सोमोन्दो थानाय थाबायनायाव गोब्राब जायो'।

question: बे स्केबिजनि फाहामनाया मा?
answer: सुंद' फोरमायथियाव बुंनाय जादों दि "स्केबिजखौ 17 एप्रिलखालि आइभारमेक्टिनजों फाहामनाय जादोंमोन, जायखौ 7 सानाव खालामफिननांगौमोन।"

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceBptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. question: आंनि थानाय समाव आंनि ब्रेन स्केन (इ.इ.जि.) आ सरासनस्रामोन नामा?
answer: नंगौ, 19/12 आव खालामनाय इ.इ.जि.आ 'गोख्रों गोसारनाय एनकेफेल'पेथि' दिन्थिदोंमोन, नाथाय 22/12 आव खालामनाय इ.इ.जि.आ 'सिगांनि ट्रेसिंनि सायाव गोबां जौगानाय' दिन्थिदोंमोन।

question: आंनि सी.ति. स्केनआ मा दिन्थिदों?
answer: खर'नि कम्पिउटेड टम'ग्राफीआव जेबो गोनांथार सोलायनाय नुनो मोनाखै। बिखानि कम्पिउटेड टम'ग्राफीआव जेबो बारदेरग्रा बिखान्थिनि सिन नुनो मोनाखै।

question: जेब्ला आं देहा फाहामसालिनिफ्राय ओंखारो अब्ला आं मा खालामगासिनो दं?
answer: सुंद’ फोरमायथियाव बुंनाय जादोंदि नोंथाङा ‘सरासनस्रा थासारियाव’ दं, ‘दैजों आबुं’ आरो ‘लोमजानाय गैयै’ (लोमजानाय गैया)। नोंथांनि ‘ग्लासग’ 14’ आ ‘गासैबो मोनब्रै आखान्थिफोरखौ दैखांनो आरो बोथोबखौ लाखिनो हायो’, आरो ‘बिथोनफोरखौ बुजिनानै मानियो’।

computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: आंनि थैया हारिमुफोराव मा मोनदों?
answer: 12/19 खालारनि थै बिजिरनायाव स्टेफिलोकोकास हमिनिस मोनदोंमोन। 01/16 खालारनि थै बिजिरनायाव स्युड'मनास एरुगिन'सा मोनदोंमोन।

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: आं मानो देहा-फाहामसालियाव थिसनजादोंमोन?
answer: नोंहा 'गोब्राब गोरान गुजुनाय, आगसि हेमेट'रेक्सआव सानाय, आरो सरासनस्रा थासारिनि गाज्रि जानाय' दंमोन। नोंखौ 'लोरबां सरासनस्रा थासारि, हाइप'टेन्सिव (खम थै नारथाय), हां लानायाव फेलें' जों रिफार्द खालामनाय जादोंमोन।

answer: He was put on 'శ్వాస-প্রশ্বাস' and 'ఊపిరితిత్తుల నుండి గాలిని బయటకు పంపే గొట్టం ద్వారా గాలిని లోపలికి పంపే'  এবং 'తీవ్రమైన శ్రద్ధ'  అందింపజోయా।

question: आंनि सी.ति. स्केनआ मा दिन्थिदों?

answer: नोंनो 6 मार्चनिफ्राय ‘सनदेरनाय बिखानथिनि थाखाय ‘सेफ्ट्रियाक्सन, क्लिन्डामाइसिन आरो क्लारिथ्रमाइसिन’ होनाय जादोंमोन। ‘सेप्टिक सकनि थाखाय, बेखौ 5 मार्चआव पिपेरासिलिन, टेजलबेक्टाम आरो भेनकामिसिनआव सोलायनाय जादोंमोन’।

answer: जेब्ला नों फैदोंमोन, नोंनि थै नारथाया खम जादोंमोन। 5थि/6थि सानाव, नों 'सेप्टिक शक' आव दंमोन, आरो 'भेस' मुलिया 4थि/6थि सिम सोलिगासिनो दंमोन।
